items.title: One of Africa’s Most Important Water Sources Just Got Some Very Good News
items.description: A vast wetland system that feeds water supplies for much of central and southern Africa has remained largely outside the global conservation spotlight, even as climate change and environmental degradation increased the stakes. Angola has now moved to change that. In January, Angolan officials announced the designation of the country’s first wetland of international importance […]

items.title: Colorado River Negotiators Are Nearly Out of Time and Snowpack
items.description: Time and water are running low on the Colorado River. items.description: FREMONT, N.C.—On a chilly afternoon in early January, Samantha Krop, the Neuse riverkeeper, and Taylor Register, a water quality specialist, trekked along a ditch near White Oaks Farm in Wayne County. items.description: In 2024, New York City’s Department of Sanitation rolled out a mandatory curbside organics collection program, aiming to reduce landfill waste and cut methane emissions by allowing residents to set out their food scraps once a week for collection and composting.
